stadium.name: The Aegis Field
stadium.description: A pristine field within the main temple compound, used as the central training ground for the Shield. The pitch is bordered by the library and monastery, and is said to be protected by the twin lights, Dawn's Hope and Silver Twilight.

stats.pregame_ritual: Tying their bootlaces together and hopping to the starting line.
Re-taping their shield's handle with fresh leather.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Drinking a full waterskin of lukewarm water.
Drawing a detailed, anatomically incorrect diagram of a troll's head.
Passing a 'team luckstone' from player to player without speaking.
Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Kissing their biceps and whispering words of encouragement to them.
Trying to teach a stray dog a complicated and useless new trick.
Challenging a spectator to a game of tic-tac-toe in the dirt.

stadium.name: The Buccaneer's Bowl
stadium.description: A flashy, pristine stadium built on a private beach exclusively for resort guests. The field is imported turf, and a massive, puppet kraken in the bay entertains the crowd at halftime.

stats.pregame_ritual: Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Sticking leeches to their legs to 'lighten their step'.
Bribing a local oracle with a meat pie for a vague prophecy.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.
Reading their own fortune in a scattering of knuckle bones.
Thanking their armor for the protection it's about to offer.
Painting their teeth with a mixture of charcoal and water.
Doing a series of loud, guttural breathing exercises.
Reciting their grocery list backward to clear their mind.
Clapping their hands a prime number of times.
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.

preGame:
# THE DECIDER ON THE HOLY TURF! üèÜ

Well, hello there, all you ghouls and gals, it's your favorite demon of the airwaves, Nok the Corrupter, coming to you live from the Aegis Field for the grand finale of this Best of 3 slugfest! We are tied up, one apiece, and the atmosphere in Haven today is thicker than the incense in the Temple of Light compound! It‚Äôs the Haven Lights versus the Tortell Privateers in a win-or-go-home‚Äîwell, win-or-go-to-the-loser's-bracket‚Äîshowdown! The crowd is buzzing, though I see a few too many 'adventurers' in the stands for my liking. Is that Sir Tanos over there? Try not to stab me during the halftime show, big guy! üó°Ô∏è

The Privateers are looking salty and ready for a scrap. I just saw Keisling Damalas painting his teeth with charcoal‚Äînow that‚Äôs the kind of dental hygiene I can get behind! And Melisande Eustacia is huddled up with the team, probably going over those hand signals for secret plays. They‚Äôre going to need all the tricks they can muster to overcome the 'Twinlight's Glow' that‚Äôs currently making the field look like a stage for a bad play. If these 'distracted tourists' don't stop taking pictures, I might have to go down there and show them what a real monster looks like! üì∏

Meanwhile, the Haven Lights are up to their usual holier-than-thou pre-game nonsense. Dickenson Beker is currently trying to teach a stray dog a trick. Honestly, Beker, the dog has more chance of scoring than you do if you keep playing like you did in Game 1! And look at Riffle Harrington, hopping to the starting line like a common rabbit. It‚Äôs a playoff atmosphere, folks! The pressure is on, the ground is hallowed, and the blood is ready to flow. Let's get this rubber match started! üçñ‚õ™
postGame:
# THE SHIELD PREVAILS... UNFORTUNATELY! üïØÔ∏è‚ö°

Gather 'round, boils and ghouls, for the final word on tonight‚Äôs playoff decider! I‚Äôm Nok the Corrupter, and I‚Äôm reporting through a thick cloud of holy smoke that‚Äôs doing wonders for my sinuses‚Äîand not the good kind! The Haven Lights have managed to clinch the series with a 4 to 2 victory over the Tortell Privateers! It was a gritty, ugly, and delightfully violent affair that sends the 'Heroes' to the next round and the Privateers packing for the loser's bracket. I guess the 'Twinlight's Glow' wasn't just for show tonight, though I still think the ref was blind to half the fouls! ü¶ì

The action kicked off with a flurry of activity in Center Field as Dickenson Beker snagged the Trollball. After some back-and-forth shuffling, Farand Keil found himself in the Away Field and decided he‚Äôd had enough of running. He launched a beautiful 2-point Shoot that zipped right through the goal! Just like that, the Lights were up 2-0, and the Temple crowd was cheering loud enough to wake the God King Artorias himself! It was a clinical start for a team that usually spends too much time praying and not enough time playing! üéØ

But the Lights weren't content with a small lead. After a chaotic scramble that saw Melisande Eustacia fail to tackle Shiroma Salim, the ball ended up back with Zwart Bunns. Now, Zwart might whisper fears to the ball, but he clearly has a good relationship with it, because he fired another 2-point Shoot from the Away Field! 4-0! The Privateers were looking like they‚Äôd spent too much time at the Toast Island Resort and not enough time in the gym! ‚õ±Ô∏è

The Privateers finally showed a spark of life when Berkin Waters threw a wild pass that was snagged right out of the air by Loralee Sunny! That interception was the turning point of the first half. Kidder Starkey took the rock and moved it forward, allowing Lilithe Royce to line up a 2-point Shoot from the Home Field! It sailed through, cutting the lead to 4-2. For a moment, it looked like the Privateers might actually pull off another upset, but the 'Shield's Watch' was just getting started! üõ°Ô∏è

Let‚Äôs talk about the hits, because that‚Äôs where the real poetry happens! Ellan Elburt decided he didn't like Farand Keil's face and tackled him so hard that Keil had to be hauled off the field with an injury! That‚Äôs what I like to see‚Äîplayoff intensity! The first half ended with a flurry of failed tackles, leaving the score at 4-2 and the ground stained with enough 'heroic' sweat to fill a swimming pool. üíß

Halftime saw everyone return to the field, but the Privateers‚Äô momentum had vanished like a ghost in the sun. Keisling Damalas tried to get things moving, but the Lights' defense was stifling. We saw Dickenson Beker‚Äîthe dog-trainer herself‚Äîdeliver a massive tackle on Melisande Eustacia, sending him to the sidelines for a rest he didn't ask for! The violence was escalating, and I was loving every minute of it! ü¶¥

Then came the Dib Tufts show! Dib decided that if he couldn't score, he‚Äôd at least make sure the other team couldn't walk. He leveled Dickenson Beker, injuring her! Then, just for good measure, he turned around and absolutely flattened Tybi Reo, sending her to join Beker in the infirmary! It was a masterclass in brutality that briefly gave the Privateers a numbers advantage, but they just couldn't capitalize on the open space! üè•

The Lights weren't about to let the Privateers have all the fun, though. Dickenson Beker, apparently fueled by spite and the 'Twinlight's Glow,' came back and absolutely wrecked Loralee Sunny! Not to be outdone, Melisande Eustacia returned the favor by injuring Berkin Waters! It was a revolving door of pain in the second half, with players spending as much time on the healer's bench as they did on the field! ü©π

In the closing minutes, Goldberg Tova made sure Dickenson Beker wouldn't forget this game, tackling her into the dirt and injuring her for the second time today! Talk about a rough day at the office! Despite the Privateers' best efforts to turn the game into a wrestling match, they couldn't find the basket again. The Lights played keep-away and relied on their early cushion to see the game through. ü••

So, the final tally stands at 4-2. The Haven Lights win the series 2-1 and move on, while the Tortell Privateers head to the loser's bracket to rethink their life choices. Maybe less meat-pie oracles and more actual practice next time, eh? I‚Äôm Nok the Corrupter, and I‚Äôm off to see if I can find where Sir Tanos left his sword‚ÄîI‚Äôve got some 'letters' that need stabbing! Until next time, keep your weapons sharp and your trolls' heads flying! üíÄüèÅ
